page.title: 18HOBBIES ON ALSTON MOOR
page.content: Hobbies differ in Alston Moor from traditional to new ideas. In season,grouse and pheasant shooting is very popular; this is one of the traditional hobbies. Beating(walking in a line to raise the birds) has been going on for many years. There are several clubs which satisfy people's interests and help them with their hobbies. The Alston Ski Club has been running about 18 months and is very popular because of the climate that we get, and looks to having a promising future. A part of the Town Hall is now a Social Club. This will be open during the day and in the evening. For the girls and boys between 7 and 11 years of age there are Brownies and Cubs, and for those between 12 and 16 there are Guides, Scouts and the Youth Club.
